messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom]Homicide/Murder was re: bible questions
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/16/02 4:42:51 PM Central Daylight Time, ... I could be wrong, but I think that after someone has been killed by whatever means is used
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/16/02 4:42:51 PM Central Daylight Time,
patti.schmidt2@... writes:


> The death penalty is legal in this country- usually for truly heinous
> crimes. Is the person administering the lethal injection absolved from any
> mortal guilt since they're not technically breaking the law and therefore
> not "murdering?"
>

I could be wrong, but I think that after someone has been killed by whatever
means is used for the death penalty, that the death certificate reads [cause
of death] [Homicide]. Are they absolved? I guess that depends on their
personal ideals, views, morals... State sanctioned homicide? Yes. Legal? Yes.
Is homicide legal? No. Good debate for (or against?) the death penalty
~Nancy who really doesn't want to debate the death penality. :o)


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
